Package algorithms.compGeometry

Class ClosestPairBetweenSets

java.lang.Object
algorithms.compGeometry.ClosestPairBetweenSets
public class ClosestPairBetweenSets extends Object
NOT READY FOR USE. Find the closest pair of points between two sets of points by using divide and conquer to reduce the number of comparisons From pseudocode in Intro to Algorithms by Cormen et al. runtime complexity was ~ O(N lg N), but changes have been made for set2 that add at most O(3*3) to the smallest of recursive steps. NOTE: this class has not been thoroughly tested yet. The case when set1 is completely embedded in set2 is not solved correctly, so need to revise this.
Author:
nichole

      find the closest pair within the two x,y sets of points.
      Parameters:

      set2 -
      Returns:
      returns 5 items in array: shortest distance between pairs, pt1 x, pt1 y, pt2 x, pt2 y

    • divide

      protected ClosestPairBetweenSets.ClosestPairInt divide(List<algorithms.util.PairIntWithIndex> p, List<algorithms.util.PairIntWithIndex> x, List<algorithms.util.PairIntWithIndex> y)
      use divide and conquer to find the pair of points with the smallest separation. note that x and y have to contain objects that are the same instance as the objects in p.
      Parameters:
      p - should be ordered left to right already
